Here we use large amounts of water to dissolve and remove impurities from our raw material, which consists of used paper delivered the form of dry bales, and/or paper pulp. The Hamburger Spremberg paper factory processes only used paper. Most of this comes from households and department stores. It takes great deal of effort to recycle this kind of used paper: the paper pulp must be directed through many machines with perforated and slot sieves, to attain the highest possible level of separation from unwanted impurities. After the material is prepared, we inject additives such as starch, colours or filler mediums, which are necessary to attain the required paper qualities. Paper machine The paper machine takes the ready prepared fibre suspension and makes endless length of paper from it. A paper machine is single system over 100 metres length, with three main sections: Sieve section Pressing section Drying section In the first section of the paper machine, the fibre pulp coming from the material preparation department is greatly thinned with water, that each litre of the mixture only contains approx. seven grams of fibre and filler. This suspension is then sprayed evenly through wide nozzle over the entire working width of rolling sieve. The water runs away or is suctioned out, and the fibres fall onto the sieve, forming fibre web. After this sheet forming process, the length of paper still contains about 80% water. The paper machine at Hamburger Spremberg has three sheet forming units like this, and their fibre webs are laid together as single length of paper before running into the next processing step. By layering the structure of the paper, high-quality raw fibre materials can be used targeted way to create certain product qualities such as whiteness, firmness, etc. Further dehydration of the paper is completed by mechanical pressure the pressing section. Here the paper is moved by felt belts between rollers and exposed to high pressure. This pressing procedure raises the dry content to approx. 52% and the paper becomes stronger. Then the drying section the remaining water is steamed out by adding heat energy. The paper runs like slalom through steam-heated drying cylinders. To influence certain properties of firmness and printability, targeted unit is installed the drying section to apply starch and lime on the paper’s surface. The smoothing unit at the end of the drying section has the task of creating smooth surface and consistent thickness. After leaving the drying section, the paper is now finished and is subjected to several quality checks by means of measuring frame. Here, various parameters such as thickness, colour, surface weight and dampness and their consistency across the whole width of the paper are checked and documented. At the end of the paper machine, the finished paper is rolled up on steel reels. Finishing Before being delivered to the customer, the paper must be cut to the desired length and width. The reel-cutting machine splits the machine rolls into smaller rolls. Then these are finished with steel bands and stickers according to the customer’s wished. Here’s little flashback to our beginnings and the first five years of paper manufacture. 26th November 2010: First 1.5 million tonnes of paper Today marks the completion of the production of total of 1,500,000 million tonnes of paper Spremberg since the commissioning of the paper machine. 1st September 2009: Press conference EBS project Press conference on the projected construction of waste-to-energy plant. 1st July 2009: Changeover to 100% white papers We now produce exclusively white corrugated cardboard raw papers. Since the PM 7 paper machine at Hamburger Hungaria is now operation and specialises manufacturing brown papers, we are specialising mass production of the white papers SpreeWhite B and SpreeWhite C. 19th March 2009: We’re Millionaires The one millionth tonne of paper produced the Hamburger Spremberg paper factory. Originally the jubilee planned for month later. The reason for successful production is the significantly higher availability of the paper machine. This attained by having almost no rips during manufacture. According to our ambitious goals, the system’s optimisation process able to be proceeded with the shortest possible time. 19th December 2008: Permit for power station received Because of ever increasing energy costs, we searched for possible alternatives to supply our factory. Due to many individual factors and extensive studies, the choice is made: surrogate fuel power station, which means it consumes refuse-derived fuel. This is medium-calorific combination of processed municipal waste and non-dangerous burnable waste. The steam this produces is used to heat the dry part of our PM 1 and to generate electric energy using steam turbine and generator. In this way we can gain maximum of 65 tonnes of stea and 22.5 megawatts of electric power. We are planning to burn the rejects produced during the manufacturing process at Hamburger Spremberg. After informational events and another event to explain the system, the permit is given to us. 6th November 2008: We are awarded the Brandenburg Apprenticeship Prize Hamburger Spremberg is the only company the district of the Cottbus Chamber of Commerce to be awarded the Brandenburg Apprenticeship Prize. We received this prize because we maintain very good conditions of cooperation with four schools, from primary to high school. The training of our apprentices is exemplary, not only quantity but quality. 20th August 2008: New paper type - Bico Our SpreeWhite BiCo is the first "new type" our as yet short company history. Within the framework of our product development, which is certified according to German Industry Norm (DIN) EN ISO 9001:2008, we were able to develop white testliner expressly for processing into the backing of corrugated cardboard. 22nd May 2008: Six Sigma Project succeeds Our "Leading Quality White" stabilised and optimised by working on the printability properties within Six Sigma project. Six Sigma combines known quality tools with complex statistical approaches. This approach enabled us to set further standard the market segment for white, unpainted mass papers. 23rd July 2007: Announcement - 2nd paper machine is built The Hamburger Spremberg paper factory builds the second paper machine the Black Pump Industrial Park. The manager informed Prinzhorn Holding GmbH on the 16th Juli 2007. This announcement makes it official: the second paper machine is to be built. 12th May 2007 and 16th May 2009: Open Day at the company On the second and third company open days, which is now initiative of the Government of the Federal State of Brandenburg, thousands of interested visitors come to view our production facilities and enjoy conversations with employees. Among the guests 2007 our prime minister Matthias Platzeck. 5th December 2006: Millionth tonne of corrugated cardboard raw paper one year is produced It’s something special to belong to the Paper Millionaires Club. There are only four our area Europe. Since this day, Hamburger belongs to it. The millionth tonne of raw paper the company produced. In total it then even came to 1,064,000 tonnes at the end of the year. Of that, 404,000 tonnes were from W. Hamburger Pitten, 114,000 from Rieger Paper Factory, 302,000 from Dunapack, and 244,000 from Hamburger Spremberg. The jubilee roll is produced Spremberg as SpreeWhite. In the company of small sales delegation, the roll, with red ribbon, is delivered few days later to the company ROBA Corrugated GmbH Zorbau, Saxony-Anhalt. 10th April 2006: ISO Certification 9001:2000 Hamburger Spremberg’s efforts are recognisd with the German Industry DIN EN ISO 9001:2000 certification. 17th November 2005: 100,000 tonnes of paper produced In the evening we celebrate the 100,000th tonne of paper Spremberg. The jubilee paper is white and is part of delivery to Romania. 18th October 2005: Inauguration of the paper factory Among the hundred invited guests are Brandenburg’s prime minister Matthias Platzeck and Brandenburg’s minister of economics Ulrich Junghanns. Platzeck said his speech that the successful establishment of the paper factory Lusatia cannot be valued too highly. 27th September 2005: Mosburger starts corrugated cardboard production Mosburger Corrugated’s facility for corrugated cardboard starts producing first-class corrugated cardboard. The system runs 1 ½ shift operation from Monday to Friday and produces over 250,000 m² of corrugated cardboard every day - that’s more than 100 tonnes of paper. After the corrugated cardboard system starts up, it’s only few more days until the first four-colour-printed packaging can be created. 27th August 2005: Open Day at the company The first company open day at the Hamburger Spremberg paper factory: more than 10,000 visitors from the region are shown how hard it is to make paper. Among the guests are Hoyerswerda’s head mayor Horst-Dieter Braehmig and Spremberg’s mayor Dr. Klaus-Peter Schulze. 14th April 2005: Delivery to customers Seven days after paper production begins, the first paper is sent to overseas customers. 7th April 2005: First roll of paper produced At 3:25 PM the first reel of our paper is rolled up. We’ve done it - the first paper from Black Pump is produced. 15th December 2004: Trial operations begin On this day, actual startup begins with trial runs of three feeding conveyors, the disc filter, the vacuum system, the top layer pulper, and the spin test for the first dry component. All systems run to our complete satisfaction. 29th October 2004: New brands are registered At the German patent office Munich, new brand names are registered for the paper to be produced future by Hamburger Spremberg: Brown: SpreeLiner and SpreeWelle White:SpreeWhite 10th September 2004: Structural Completion Celebration After eleven months of building, another step is complete. A celebration is held. The partitioned reel warehouse serves as the event venue. On bright sunny day, several hundred people come to be impressed by the dimensions of the future factory and the fast construction progress. Two cabinet ministers carry best greetings from Brandenburg’s prime minister Matthias Platzeck. Minister of finance Ulrich Junghanns declares that momentum for further economic development Lausitz is emanating from the establishment of W. Hamburger AG the Black Pump Industry Park. Szymanski, Minister of Construction and Traffic, promises to build the town bypass road as quickly as possible to further raise the attraction of the location. June 2004: New employees arrive Approx. 300 employees are wanted, and over 6,000 applications have come in. The number of employees grows every month, from 15 Juni 2004 and 95 December 2004 up to 261employees and 29 apprentices December 2005. 17th October 2003: The first ground is broken The party tent with 240 seats is completely full. More than dozen cameramen and large number of radio reporters crowd around the stage. In his welcome speech, Thomas Prinzhorn says publicly for the first time that the people of the Lusatia area are one of the deciding factors choosing this location. Brandenburg’s prime minister Matthias Platzeck thanks Thomas Prinzhorn for the investment and praises the groundbreaking ceremony as important part of increasing the value of economic structures Lusatia. 3rd September 2003: Signing the supplier contract W. Hamburger AG as investor for the future Hamburger Spremberg paper factory signs the sales contract with the supplier for the paper machine worth millions Black Pump. The contract is awarded to the Japanese company MITSUBISHI. 14th Februar 2003: Contracts are made A piece of property the Black Pump Industrial Park is purchased by Hamburger by sales contract dated 14th February 2003 from its owner, Lusatian and Central German Mining Administration GmbH. After extensive clearing of the future construction site, the old owner hands over the land for building the paper factory. Black Pump This is the right place to tell little story - the story of the black pump, or how the area got its name: The name comes from the Middle Ages and defined around the end of the Thirty Years’ War. According to tradition, marauding Swedish soldiers moved through Lusatia as they retreated. They approached the little settlement on the Bohemian Road between Leipzig and Cottbus, plundering, burning and murdering as they came. To prevent this danger, the inhabitants used the fear of the plague. The water pump at the inn’s well coloured black to show that the plague had taken over this village. Ever since, the inn called the Black Pump Restaurant. When it burned down 1920 the new Black Pump Inn built, and it still stands today. KG | Produktion | Papierherstellung DE | EN Unternehmen Startseite Aktuelles Hamburger Rieger Unternehmenspolitik Spreerecycling Geschichte Spremberg Geschichte Trostberg Hamburger Containerboard Besucherinformation Einkaufsbedingungen Altpapierannahmebedingungen Allgemeine Verkaufs- Lieferbedingungen Produktion Produkte Papierherstellung Leistungsdaten Maschinenkonzept SB Maschinenkonzept TB Qualitätsstandards Umwelt Rohstoffe Kreislaufwirtschaft Abwasseraufbereitung Karriere Berufsbilder Ausbildungsstart 2015 Stellenangebote Praktikum Ferienarbeit Presse 100 Jahre Papier Presseaussendungen Presseberichte Downloads Kontakt Anfahrtsplan Ansprechpartner Kontakt Länder Unterkunft Die Papierherstellung Eine Papierfabrik gliedert grundsätzlich Anlagenbereiche: Stoffaufbereitung Papiermaschine Ausrüstung Stoffaufbereitung Der Produktionsprozess beginnt Stoffaufbereitung. Hier Form trockenen Ballen angelieferte Rohstoffe Altpapier und/oder Zellstoff Wasser aufgelöst Verunreinigungen befreit. Das Altpapier stammt überwiegend Haushalten Kaufhäusern. Das Recycling derartiger Altpapiere erfordert hohen Reinigungsaufwand: Papierbrei Vielzahl Aggregaten gelochten geschlitzten Sieben geführt werden, möglichst vollständige Abtrennung störenden Verunreinigungen erreichen. Am Ende Stoffaufbereitung erfolgt Zugabe Hilfsmitteln, z. B. Stärke, Farb- Füllstoffe, Erzielung erforderlichen Papiereigenschaften notwendig sind. Papiermaschine Die Papiermaschine übernimmt fertig aufbereitete Faserstoffsuspension stellt endlose Papierbahn her. Unter Papiermaschine über 100 zusammenhängende Anlage vorstellen, folgende Hauptsektionen gegliedert ist: Siebpartie Pressenpartie Trockenpartie Im Bereich Papiermaschine Stoffaufbereitung kommende Faserstoffbrei stark verdünnt, Liter Faserstoff-Wasser-Gemisches ca. Gramm Faser- Füllstoff enthalten sind. Diese Suspension mittels breiten Düse gleichmäßig über gesamte Arbeitsbreite umlaufenden Siebes verteilt. Während Wasser abläuft abgesaugt lagern Fasern Sieb bilden Faserflies. Am Ende sog. Blattbildungsprozesses enthält Papierbahn ca. 80 Prozent Wasser. Die Papiermaschine Hamburger Rieger Papierfabrik Spremberg besitzt derartiger Blattbildungsanlagen, Faserfliese Einlauf nächste Prozessstufe Papierbahn zusammengeführt werden. Durch mehrlagigen Aufbau Papierbahn können hochwertige Faserrohstoffen gezielt Erzeugung bestimmter Produkteigenschaften Weiße, Festigkeitseigenschaften usw. eingesetzt werden. Die Entwässerung Papierbahn erfolgt mechanischen Druck Pressenpartie. Hierzu mittels Filzbahnen Walzen hindurchgeführt hohen Pressdruck ausgesetzt. Durch Pressvorgang Trockengehalt ca. 52 % erreicht Bahnfestigkeit erhöht. In anschließenden Trockenpartie restliche Wasser Zufuhr Wärmeenergie ausgedampft. Die Papierbahn slalomartig über dampfbeheizte Trockenzylinder geführt. Zur gezielten Beeinflussung bestimmten Festigkeits- Druckeigenschaften Trockenpartie Aggregat Auftrag Stärke Leim Papieroberfläche installiert. Die Erzeugung glatten Oberfläche gleichmäßige Blattdicke Aufgabe Glättwerkes, Ende Trockenpartie befindet. Nach Verlassen Trockenpartie fertige Papierbahn mittels Messrahmens mehreren genauen Qualitätskontrollen unterzogen. Dabei mehrere Parameter, Dicke, Farbe, Flächengewicht Feuchte gemessen gleichmäßige Verteilung über Bahnbreite kontrolliert dokumentiert. Am Ende Papiermaschine fertige Papierbahn Stahlwalzen (Tamboure) aufgewickelt. Ausrüstung Vor Auslieferung Kunden Papier gewünschte Länge Breite geschnitten werden. In Rollenschneidemaschine erfolgt Aufteilung Maschinenrollen kleinere Rollen. Anschließend kundenspezifisch Stahlbändern Etiketten ausgerüstet.
